quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Pandas and Panda
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, starfish, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How long does a panda usually live in captivity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 20 - 30 years

questions.question: Which of these is TRUE about pandas?

options.text: They belong to the raccoon family.
They were unknown to the Western world until the 1600s.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are carnivores.

questions.question: All starfish have 5 arms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the 1930s movie King Kong, the giant ape battles a pterodactyl.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Starfish are capable of both asexual and sexual reproduction.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many stomachs does a starfish have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: The panda has an enlarged wristbone that works as an opposable thumb.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When a panda is born, it is impossible to tell if it is male or female. How old is the panda before its gender is known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 years

questions.question: Pandas spend 10-16 hours a day eating, the rest of the time they are usually resting. When are pandas most active?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: at dusk and at dawn

questions.question: Pandas are known to roar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Pandas live and travel together.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Pandas do not hibernate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In which country is the Gohongaze Starfish considered an edible delicacy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japan

questions.question: A starfish cannot regenerate a lost arm.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The panda is the symbol of this conservation organization, formed in 1961.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The World Wildlife Fund

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Starfish and Food
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, starfish, cottontail. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Catfish are bony fish that are active in the nighttime. How did they get their interesting name?

options.text: They have barbels that remind of cat whiskers.
They like to rub against objects like cats do.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have barbels that remind of cat whiskers.

questions.question: Scorpions are active at night in order to avoid which of their predators?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The Ocelot is a nocturnal cat that is also called by this name in certain regions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Mink are mainly active at night and they do not hibernate. Which of these animals is a predator of the American Mink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Starfish are fast moving creatures.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What animal is the largest nocturnal prosimian on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aye-aye

questions.question: Tapeti is a nocturnal cottontail rabbit that is indigenous to these areas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Central and South America

questions.question: There are two classes of starfish. Name them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea Star and Brittle Stars

questions.question: What sense helps kiwis find food in the dark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sense of smell

questions.question: Kakapo is a nocturnal parrot indigenous to New Zealand. Due to its resemblance to this nocturnal animal, it is also called by its name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Owl

questions.question: Which of these is not a relative of the starfish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea Horse

questions.question: Fireflies are known for their ability to produce light of this color.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: A starfish is a type of fish.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Raccoons are usually nocturnal animals, and they are famous for dousing their food before eating it. This is actually an activity that imitates foraging for food at shores. What is the term for such an activity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vacuum activity

questions.question: What is located on the end of every arm of a starfish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eye

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Statements and Dolphins
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, kind, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the diet of Green iguanas?

options.text: Young iguanas are known to eat the feces of mature iguanas.
Wild iguanas sometimes eat bird eggs.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Is dolphins sense of hearing superior to that of humans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: How many different species of dolphins are there in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 32

questions.question: What kind of herbivorous animals are the granivores?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Animals that feed on seeds

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the tongue of the giraffe?

options.text: The animal uses it as a tool to remove insects from its face.
It is about 18 inches (45 centimeters) long.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about squirrels?

options.text: Most squirrels are active in the daytime.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the meaning of the term graminivore?

options.text: an animal that feeds on fruit
an animal that feeds on seaweed
an animal that feeds on grass
an animal that feeds on tree leaves

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an animal that feeds on grass

questions.question: Which is the smallest species of dolphin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maui Dolphin/Hectors Dolphin

questions.question: How do dolphins generally sleep if they are in the wild?

options.text: with only one brain hemisphere in slow-wave sleep

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: with only one brain hemisphere in slow-wave sleep

questions.question: What is the average speed dolphins can reach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16.5 km/hr

questions.question: Which of these foods does the Canada goose include in its diet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the digestive system of the Hoatzin, a herbivorous tropical bird?

options.text: It has teeth that it uses for mastication.
It breaks down its food through bacterial fermentation.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It breaks down its food through bacterial fermentation.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about grasshoppers?

options.text: Their digestive tract secretes digestive enzymes.
They have two antennae on their heads.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: How deep can a bottlenose dolphin dive?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 300 meters

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about elephants?

options.text: Their diet consists of 80% tree leaves.
They are able to digest 40% of their food.
They spend 8-10 hours a day eating.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are able to digest 40% of their food.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Jaguars and Jaguar
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, regions, bite. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Jaguars closely resemble which other big cats in physical appearance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leopard

questions.question: The jaguar is the national animal of which of the following countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brasil

questions.question: In nature adult jaguars are apex predators in the food chain. What does this mean?

options.text: They are not preyed on by other predators.
They feed only on other predators.
They do not hunt on other predators.
Besides hunting they also feed on plants.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are not preyed on by other predators.

questions.question: What common name is used to refer to the scavenging animals, representatives of the order Opiliones?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvestmen

questions.question: Which continents does the natural habitat of the jaguar span upon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North and South America

questions.question: All but one of the following activities are generally untypical for jaguars. Choose the one most natural to them.

options.text: Starting to eat their prey from the fleshy abdominal area

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stalking and ambushing their prey

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the diet of the Sumatran rhinoceros?

options.text: It feeds mainly in the morning and before dusk.
It consumes about 220 lb (100 kg) of food daily.
Its diet is rich in protein and poor in fiber.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It feeds mainly in the morning and before dusk.

questions.question: The jaguars extremely powerful bite, which can pierce through a turtles shell, makes it the mammal with the strongest jaw in the animal kingdom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What term is mainly used in literature to refer to a group of crows?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A murder

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true about the reproduction of jaguars?

options.text: Female jaguars reach maturity earlier than males.
Both males and females provide parenting of the cubs.
Jaguars mate throughout the whole year.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both males and females provide parenting of the cubs.

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the word raccoon, which originates from the Algonquin word ahrah-koon-em and denotes a scavenging mammal?

options.text: One who grasps with their hand just like a human
One who rubs, scrubs and scratches with its hands
One who eats whatever is in front of them
One who washes their hands and their food before eating

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One who rubs, scrubs and scratches with its hands

questions.question: What continent does the large Griffon Vulture inhabit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: How can jaguars be described in terms of social activity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Solitary

questions.question: In jaguars society only male animals hunt while females look after the cubs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Jaguars appearance seems to vary across regions and habitats. How do forest jaguars differ from the jaguars in open areas?

options.text: Forest jaguars are generally darker and larger
Forest jaguars are generally and more spotted
Forest jaguars are generally darker and smaller
Forest jaguars are generally larger and lighter in fur color

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forest jaguars are generally darker and smaller

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Parrots and Planet
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, birds, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the color of the eggs of all parrot species?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White

questions.question: What hyena species is the largest surviving on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spotted Hyena

questions.question: What is the predominant color in Amazon Parrots plumage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the parrots breeding habits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parrots are monogamous.

questions.question: Which of these makes Cockatoos different from other parrot species?

options.text: They are not so colorful as other parrots.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Larger parrot species have longer life spans than smaller ones. What is the average life span of a large parrot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Up to 80 years

questions.question: What term refers to the animal that is the result of crossbreeding between a male coyote and a female dog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coydog

questions.question: Parrots are considered the most intelligent birds on the planet along with these birds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The heaviest parrot species on the planet is the Kakapo. What is the average weight that a normal mature Kakapo can reach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 to 4 kg

questions.question: These parrots are believed to be the best at imitating sounds and human speech.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: African Grey Parrot

questions.question: What kind of animals are the Yellow jackets, the scavenging and predatory animals belonging to the genera Vespula and Dolichovespula?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wasps

questions.question: Which of these names is commonly used for the carrion flies, belonging to the family Calliphoridae?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What do the beetles from the genus Nicrophorus do after finding a carcass?

options.text: They remain right next to it and protect it violently.
They wait for it to decompose.
They tear it into small pieces.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They bury it.

questions.question: The diet of most parrots consists of this type of food.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Lions may be skilled predators, but they would also eat carrion. What animal is the lions preferred food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wildebeest

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Cat and Breed
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, breed, cecotropes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This large cat was is the result of crossbreeding between a domestic cat and a Jungle Cat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What cat breed, also called the Greyhound of the cats, has no hair except for down?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cornish Rex

questions.question: This old breed of cat has long fur. It originated in the Middle East, and some of its representatives have a flat face.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Persian

questions.question: This cat breed originated in Russia and has a short fluffy tail.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kurilian Bobtail

questions.question: What is the common name of cecotropes, products of the cecum which rabbits reingest to get nutrients?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Night feces

questions.question: What cat breed has very thick short fur, large round eyes, round head and chubby cheeks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: British Shorthair

questions.question: What is the name of the communities formed by rabbits living together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warrens

questions.question: Lories and lorikeets have special tongues with brush-like tips for feeding on very small insects.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This cat breed is believed to have developed naturally in China. It has short golden brown fur with the so-called broken striped pattern and a large strong body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dragon Li

questions.question: This cat breed has a wild markings and is a crossbreed between an Asian Leopard Cat and a domestic cat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bengal

questions.question: This breed of cat has a round head, large round eyes and very small ears bended forward and downward.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scottish Fold

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the difference between rabbits and hares?

options.text: Unlike rabbits, hares are born with hair and are able to see.
Hares have longer ears than rabbits.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This hairless cat has a dog-like face and folded ears.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ukrainian Levkoy

questions.question: This old large cat breed occurred naturally in Europe. It has waterproof thick fluffy fur and can survive very cold weather.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norwegian Forest Cat

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the digestive tract of rabbits?

options.text: Their cecum, together with the large intestine, comprises about 25-30% of rabbits digestive tract.
Their cecum is about 5 times bigger than their stomach.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are hindgut digesters.
